bibl.title: in Collaboration with R.Ch. CALDWELL, R.W. DANIEL, and T. GAGOS, The Decipherment and Edition of the Petra Papyri: Preliminary Observations.

series.title: Culture and History of the Ancient Near East.

bibl.note: 1. Theodoros son of Obodianos and his wealthy family. - 2. Petra, a proud city of the Roman and Byzantine Empire in the sixth century. - 3. Multicultural Petra: Nabataeans, Arabs, Greeks, and Romans. - 4. Oral and written culture.

bibl.title: Semitic Papyrology in Context. A Climate of Creativity. Papers from a New York University Conference Marking the Retirement of Baruch A. Levine

bibl.seg: KOENEN Ludwig, in Collaboration with R.Ch. CALDWELL, R.W. DANIEL, and T. GAGOS, The Decipherment and Edition of the Petra Papyri: Preliminary Observations.

Lawrence H. SCHIFFMAN (Ed.), Semitic Papyrology in Context. A Climate of Creativity. Papers from a New York University Conference Marking the Retirement of Baruch A. Levine = Culture and History of the Ancient Near East. 14 (Leiden, 2003) pp. 201-226, 2 figg.

1. Theodoros son of Obodianos and his wealthy family. - 2. Petra, a proud city of the Roman and Byzantine Empire in the sixth century. - 3. Multicultural Petra: Nabataeans, Arabs, Greeks, and Romans. - 4. Oral and written culture.
